Message.Description: Unspecified error.
Not enough memory.
Result of an internal calculation is out of range.
Covariance matrix is not positive definite, and consequently, the semivariogram model is unstable.
Not enough memory (neighbors).
Not enough neighbors. The distance or number of features is too small to compute results.
Weight parameter is too small.
Input value is out of range.
Source datasets have problems.
Wrong number of datasets.
A valid semivariogram model could not be calculated.
Incorrect parameters.
A valid semivariogram model could not be calculated. Dataset has data in coincident locations, and the semivariogram model has a nugget of zero.
Calculations cancelled by user.
Lag size or number of lags is incorrect.
Error reading the geostatistical layer due to version incompatibility.
At least one data value is less than or equal to 0.
Specified Sill matrix is not positive definite in the semivariogram model.
Nugget must be greater than measurement error.
Problem with data transformation.
Results cannot be computed because of severe model design problems.
Not enough data to compute method.
Data is distributed along a straight line and cannot be processed.
At least one data value is less than 0 or greater than 1.
Problem with Normal Score transformation. Some data has declustering weights equal to zero.
Measurement error for data with coincident samples should not be equal to zero.
Valid semivariogram model could not be calculated. Variance of data is close to zero.
Variance of data is zero.
No optimum parameters can be found for this dataset.
RBF does not support the INCLUDE_ALL method of handling of coincident samples. Please select any other method in the Geostatistical Analysis Settings of the Geoprocessing Environment.
Zero Semivariogram/Covariance model cannot be used.
Specified conditioning measurement error is negative.
Spatial extents of two or more input datasets do not overlap.
At least one part of zone %s is located outside the simulated rasters. Statistics for this zone will not be calculated.
At least one part of zone %s is located outside the clipping polygon. Statistics for this zone will not be calculated.
Statistics were not calculated for any zones.
Conditioning dataset: record %s was skipped due to problem in calculating the trend for that location.
Conditioning dataset: record %s was skipped due to Overfilling.
Conditioning dataset: record %s was skipped due to problem with the Normal Score Transformation.
Conditioning dataset: record %s was skipped because it is located outside the simulated rasters.
Conditioning dataset is empty.
The maximum number of messages for the previous warning has been reached.
Input dataset is empty or all records are NODATA.
The input raster uses an unsupported geometric transformation and can not be used as input to this tool.
NULL geometry ignored. ObjectID = %s
NODATA value ignored. ObjectID = %s
Cells are only deemed to be inside a polygon if the cell center falls inside the polygon's boundary. Polygon FID = %s does not include any cell centers, so no statistics will be calculated for it.
Input dataset(s) error. %s
One or more outputs with the specified prefix exist in the workspace.
The specified geostatistical layer is not a Simple Kriging geostatistical layer.
Simulation prefix exceeds the maximum length of three symbols.
Threshold and quantile output rasters require their parameter values to be specified.
Quantile output raster requires the Quantile parameter to be specified.
Threshold output raster requires the Threshold parameter to be specified.
Can not delete one or more output datasets.
The limit of 4999 GRIDs per workspace will be exceeded if the current number of output rasters are produced.
Percentage of convergence is smaller than 99% and may indicate that the results of the simulation are not accurate.
At least one type of output has to be selected. Please choose one or more from: 1. Save simulated rasters; 2. Input statistical polygons; 3. Select one or more raster statistics.
Number of realizations is less than three. No output will be produced for StdDev and quantile statistics.
Can not find parameter '%s' in XML model.
Less than %s points are available from the input dataset. The result may be unstable or invalid.
Less than %s points are available for the moving window subset. The result may be unstable or invalid.
Parameter 'Neighbors to include' exceeds the number of points available from the input dataset. It was decreased to the number of points in the input dataset.
Parameter 'Include at least' exceeds the number of points available from the input dataset. It was decreased to the number of points in the input dataset.
Unsupported raster workspace.
'%s' is not a geostatistical layer.
Cannot load geostatistical layer or XML file.
XML is not a valid geostatistical model.
Nonvalid extension or format. Only ESRI GRID, SDE, GDB (no extension), TIFF (.tif) and IMG (.img) are allowed as raster output.
The geostatistical layer or XML file does not represent a Kriging model.
Failed to set parameters in XML model. The number of parameters is different from the number of values.
'%1!s!' is required when %2!s! is specified.
Parameter 'Include at least' must be smaller or equal to parameter 'Neighbors to include'.
'%1!s!' is not a numeric value. Parameter '%2!s!' requires a numeric value.
No prediction explanatory variables provided; the output prediction feature class will contain computed coefficients only.
Model explanatory variables must match prediction explanatory variables.
At least one part of zone %s is located outside the raster.
Raster '%s' has different extent, spatial reference, or cell size than other input rasters.
Raster '%1!s!' has values outside range %2!s!
Simulations can't be calculated when Measurement Error field is specified and Simple Kriging geostatistical layer has Normal Score Transformation with linear or direct transformation.
Invalid parameter '%1!s!'. %2!s!
Only INVERSE_MULTIQUADRATIC function supports Smooth Search Neighborhood.
You can specify only one parameter for %s.
The number of output points produced is less than number of points requested. Inhibition distance is too large or there is not enough valid data in the Input weight raster.
You must specify at least one parameter for %s.
Some rasters contain NODATA inside zones. NODATA values will not be added to the output table.
Ridge parameter is not used when the order of the polynomial is 0.
The number of output points produced is less than number of points requested.
Spatial Condition Number Threshold is not supported for power equal zero or larger than three.
Spatial Condition Number map and Prediction Standard Error map are not supported without Use Spatial Condition Number Threshold.
The version of the input geostatistical layer is not supported.
